page.title: 02WALTER POWELL,SOMERFORD AREA
page.content: The man after whom our school is named,Walter Powell,was a local M.P. and magistrate from 1868 to 1881.He was a popular "society" figure who used his wealth to assist poor people inthis area,including building reading rooms,subsidising coal prices and paying for a "ragged school" in Malmesbury.His home was in our area. He was also famous for his interest in ballooning which he used to assist the Meteorological Office.He made his own balloon from silk and flew it locally.Sadly,on December 10th 1881 he was blown out to sea while ballooning and was never seen again. Our present school has an unusual weather vane on its roof in the shape of a balloon in memory of Walter Powell.His association with the school continues through the interest of the Powell Duffryn Company.
